boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
36954.description: This version of Monopoly celebrates the United States of America. Players compete to buy properties such as the Golden Gate Bridge, Route 66, the Statue of Liberty, the Grand Canyon, and Niagara Falls. Land on the "Fourth of July" space to scoop up the cash from the center of the board.

36955.name: Boers
36955.description:
What would have happened if the Boers had won the war VS the British? How would it have changed history and the globe? In this game you can find out. This game expands into the future space exploration realm.
This game assumes they would have been similar to Nazi Germany, and maybe even helped them for awhile but would break off in the end as Germany won Europe, and Japan then would have won Asia and the Pacific and America would just hold them off so that they retained N. and S. America, but barely.

36956.name: Bombs Away
36956.description:
Bombs Away is a carrier game. You have carriers, battleships, cruisers, frigates, subs, bombers and fighters all to do battle against your opponent across an ocean map.
This was the designer's first game.

36957.name: Cattle Drive
36957.description: This is a card game about a cattle drive where you want to be the first player to get 1000 cattle to market per hand and 5000 per game. You have cards such as droughts, fires, water holes, wagons and more to prevent you opponent from getting his cattle to market, and to get more cattle of yours sold.

36958.name: Fire Away
36958.description:
Just a plain infantry war game with a few ships and airplanes....very simple. Using simple counters and a one page map, this game lets you play a quick game without many complicated rules.

Full Game: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html

36959.name: MAreenz
36959.description:
This is a mech warrior type game with 3 kinds of warriors and a number of enemy units to kill. You can have missions in this one to go grab stuff. This game is a free PnP game where you have your Mech Bots go out and try to get things against the enemy. Includes simple counters for the military, 4 hex maps and a template to create your own bots.

Full Game: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html

36960.name: Nova Glory
36960.description:
Nova Glory is a boardgame of starship fleet combat. It uses a unique mechanic so the playing pieces do all the record keeping for you. Large fleet battles play quickly and the space map tiles allow for easy placement of various terrain features such as asteroids and planets. There are four races in the game each with their own back story and distinctive play style. Strategy cards simulate lucky shots or other special situations that add an element of surprise to the game. The turn sequence keeps both players involved throughout the entire game. Game includes several scenarios in addition to basic straight up fleet duels. Rules are easy to moderate to learn.

Publishers website:www.NovaGlory.com

36961.name: La Bataille de la Bouteille, Champagne 1915
36961.description:
A wargame covering the French offensive in the Champagne during World War I, from February 16 to March 7, 1915.

Scale is one hex = 500 m, one turn = 2 days, units are regiments.

The French player moves first, then the German. Both players' turns are divided in phases: Movement/Entrenchment, Artillery, and Attack/Advance.

Eight pages of rules cover entrenching, zones of control, enfilade fire and artillery. The historical notes are another 11 pages, including a bibliography.

36962.name: Tempo
36962.description:
From the cover: "Get set! You're about to begin the fastest card game in the world"

The Dealer shuffles one pack of 55 cards and deals 11 face down to each player.
Player don't take turns in this games: everyone plays together and can make a move whenever they want.
The moves are:

1. Discarding a card: the cards you discard are spread out - face up
2. Drawing a card: you can choose any card on the table or you can take the first card of the pack.

36963.name: DICE Baseball
36963.description:
In DICE Baseball you get every player from every major league team who appeared in at least 18 at
bats or 18 innings pitched. Over 900 different players. You can replay the entire 2008 season or just
replay your favorite teams schedule. You can even replay the 2008 World Series. They are your
players and you can do what you want with them.

DICE Baseball uses more than a dozen different formulas to calculate each hitter and pitcher.
Players will perform just like they do on the field. Each and every player is rated individually.

DICE Baseball will be available in November of 2008. DICE Baseball uses two 10-sided dice to determine all of the play results. This gives you 100 different possibilities on every play.

36964.name: GEO
36964.description: GEO - An abstract strategy game where you place your 18 pieces on the board to make shapes to score points. Free download from http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/geo.htm

36965.name: Lex-O-Grams
36965.description:
Subtitled with: "5 Games of Words and Letters"

CONTENTS: The square 'box' that is ONE-inch deep by 7-inches along each side; 374 letters; and "Instructions" sheet.

The 5 Games, as detailed from the "Instructions", consist of the following:

"Anagrams": for 2 to 6 Players with the LETTERS face down, or unseen, when chosen from the pile and used to form 'words' of 3 or more from this. Before PLAY commences, then an agreed upon TOTAL of 'words' needed to Win is determined, and this continues until that amount were accomplished by someone.

"Letter Mix-up": for 2 or more players with all of the LETTERS shown face-up within easy reach for everyone during this, where an agreed upon number to form 'words' is determined before commencing PLAY, are selected by everyone, of which they must try to form a 'word' from those they've chosen. Play continues until ONLY (1) Player can form any 'word' from theirs, while the others are already having had to drop OUT from being unable to do this.

"Anagram Sentences": for 2 to 6 Players and based upon the previous "Anagrams" GAME, with forming sentences for this, and having the same 'Victory' conditions.

"The Game ADD or O-U-T": for 2 to 6 Players with the 1st Player having to select a 'word' of not less than 4 LETTERS while also NOT disclosing what that were, and ONLY placing the first LETTER beginning for their 'word' with what they've chosen. This goes on with the others putting theirs to make or add on to continue a 'word' until someone no longer can, and then they are forced out, with the LAST player remaining becoming the winner.

"Crossword Anagrams": for 2 to 6 Players with being very similar to "Scrabble" for the overall layout, while also for in this game, then all of the LETTERS are kept face-down when being selected from the pile. Everyone then chooses 15 LETTERS unseen to start off with, yet they can look at those in order to make some 'word' for placement, using portions of others already formed, or as for the entire 1st 'word' to begin the GAME with. Once they've done that, or conducted a "Discard", the Player has to "Draw" a single LETTER from either the face-up "Discard" pile (when that is created), or the others of the face-down ones, while PLAY continues until (1) Player uses all of theirs up.

36966.name: Hanga-Tanga
36966.description:
Here's a light strategy game that gives everyone a chance. These first rules require twenty-eight dice - fourteen in two different colors. I really like playing it with dice, but there's a variation described below that will easily allow players to play using as few as one die if necessary.

Also, you'll need an 8x8 checker board.

The object of Hanga-Tanga is to score the most points by arranging your dice in "lines".
(from website)

Full Game: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/HangaTanga.html

36967.name: How Not To Be Seen
36967.description:
Players try not to be seen. They must occasionally risk being seen in order to obtain points, but risk certain death if they are seen.

Conflict is resolved by dice rolling. Players use cards of any type to represent their hidden people. It can be optionally played using poker chips. Dice can have any number of sides as long as each player has a matching set.

Based (very) loosely on the Monty Python sketch of the same name.

36968.name: Shootout
36968.description: The all American western family game. For 3 to 4 players Ages 6 and up. Comes with a beautiful full-color board, spinner, and many plastic gunfighter figures.

36969.description:
Expansion to Wicked Witches Way distributed at Essen 2007.

Four pentagrams tokens are placed randomly on spaces numbered 9, 12, 15 and 18. If a witch arrives on one of these spaces, the pentagram token is turned up, and a special action takes effect.
36969.name: Flinke Feger: Die magischen Pentagramme

36970.name: Da' Pres
36970.description:
Card Game about becoming president. Includes cards for every state. Has cards about different things you can do to become president, such as "Raise Taxes", "Decrease Welfare" , "Increase Defense Budget" , "Protect Natural Resources".
Full game: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html

36971.name: Warp Away
36971.description:
Just a plain Space Conquest Game. Simple counters show different ship types. Includes a 2 page space map.
Free from: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html

36972.name: Scooby-Doo! Board Game:  The Maze of Mayhem!
36972.description:
From Publisher: "Scooby and the gang are trapped in the creepy maze. The keys to the old wooden door are buried deep so it's up to the gang to do some digging. But watch out where you dig! The last thing you need is a zombie on your trail! Be the first to find the old key and escape the Maze of Mayhem . . . on a full belly of 'Scooby Snacks' of course!"

This is a basic roll-and-move game where players race to collect a key and three snacks before escaping from the maze. The keys and snacks are all hidden throughout the board but among them are three different monsters from various Scooby-Doo episodes. Once a monster is uncovered, it remains on the board and moves on a separate die roll each turn. Monsters catch players and send them back to start, complicating the process of gathering keys and snacks and moving to the exit. Because each player has the chance to move the monsters, there are typically many opportunities to slow down the progress of other players.

36973.name: The Office DVD Board Game
36973.description:
From the manufacturer:

Join the cast of NBC's hit show "The Office" in a DVD game that features some of your favorite scenes. Answer questions about the clips to earn real Schrute bucks as you move along a game board that Dwight himself created. There's seven different kinds of trivia questions for lots of variety.

Buy Microbadge

36974.name: Mini Volgrama
36974.description:
The game for the whole family based on the Spanish TV contest from the 60's. It is similar to Crosswords.

Content:

- 1 Board
- 1 Volgrama
- 6 patterns for letters
- 179 game pieces

36975.description:
From the Publisher's website:

ATS Warfighting Guide #2 contains 52 pages of ATS material aimed at making the ATSer a system expert. Included in the new issue is George Anderson's ATS Robot, a card-based system for playing ANY ATS scenario solo with a random generation of actions by the 'enemy'.

The ATS Robot includes a set of over 50 cards (provided on cardstock for you to trim out) for use with George's solo rules.

Also included in the issue are the first installment of Drew Dorman's 'ATS Set Ups', suggested set up data for all six D-Day Ranger scenarios. You can set up either side Drew's way, then use the ATS Robot to hammer it out. Alone. Just like you like it! What's more, Drew uses the D-Day Rangers NEW Edition scenarios, which also happen to be included in the issue as a FREE bonus!

The FREE bonus approach continues...with a strip of funky new ATS leader counters bundled with EACH copy of ATS Warfighting Guide #2.

So this is it. And this is NO DRILL. The expert ATSer needs his warfighting, and he (or she) needs it now.
36975.name: ATS Warfighting Guide #2

36976.description:
This is an expansion for the board game Space Master: Star Strike and Space Master: The Role Playing Game. It includes stats for 25 different space vessels like fleet carriers, cruisers, destroyers, frigates, MMAC gunboats, TMAC fighters, SMAC fighters, survey/exploration vessels, transports, liners, freighters, scouts and orbital stations. Also included are 2 adventures for Space Master: The Role Playing Game, 11 mini-adventures for use with the included ships and 65 full-color counters.

This expansion was produced in 1989 by Iron Crown Enterprises.

Expands:

Space Master: Star Strike
36976.name: Star Strike Vessel Compendium #3: Imperial Ships

36977.description:
This is an expansion for the board game Space Master: Star Strike and Space Master: The Role Playing Game. It includes stats for 32 different space vessels like MMACs, cutters, gunboats, TMACs, destroyers, cruisers, blockade runners and free traders. Also included are 3 optional pods for payload pallets, 2 adventures for Space Master: The Role Playing Game, 11 scenarios and mini-adventures for use with the included ships and 65 full-color counters.

This expansion was produced in 1989 by Iron Crown Enterprises.

Expands:

Space Master: Star Strike
36977.name: Star Strike Vessel Compendium #2: Pursuit Class

36978.description:
This is an expansion for the board game Space Master: Star Strike and Space Master: The Role Playing Game. It includes stats for 29 different space vessels like survey/exploration vessels, freighters, shuttles, yachts, privateers, scouts, slavers, blockade runners and couriers. Also included are 2 adventures for Space Master: The Role Playing Game and 65 full-color counters.

This expansion was produced in 1989 by Iron Crown Enterprises.

Expands:

Space Master: Star Strike
36978.name: Star Strike Vessel Compendium #1: Adventurer Class

36979.name: Mythology: The Game
36979.description:
[From publisher's website:] Play the part of one of the mighty heroes of legend - Theseus, Perseus, Odysseus, Heracles, Jason, or Achilles - and work your way through the Labyrinth, battling opponents, slaying the fearsome Minotaur, and ultimately finding your way out of the maze. The Labyrinth rotates, so the challenges you face will change from game to game!

This is the fourth installment of Ology World games. The others include Dragonology : The Game, Wizardology : The Game, and Pirateology : The Game.

36980.name: The Auction Game
36980.description: Players each receive 10 counters with which to buy cards. The card deck, which consists of 24 pairs of cards, each card representing half of an article, is dealt out evenly. Each of the 24 articles fits into a category of animal, vegetable, or mineral. To start, all players look at their cards and place (face down) any pairs they may already have. They then use their counters to buy cards that other players are auctioning. Players take turns being the auctioneer. At the end of the game you want to have the most pairs. If the number of pairs is tied, the tie is broken by the number of coins.

36981.name: Wrestle Wars: Adventures in the Squared Circle
36981.description:
The ultimate objective of a Wrestle Wars character is to win the Global Super-Heavyweight Championship Belt by beating his or her opponents in one-on-one competition.

Before you begin to play Wrestle Wars you will need the following items: paper, pencils, two or more ten sided dice (d10), and at least one other player. That's it. Now you're ready to create your very own Wrestle Wars wrestler and start playing. (from site)

You create your character by rolling dice for different attributes. You have five randomly determined Character Stats: Height, Weight, Speed, Build, and Crowd Appeal.

To fight, you have to spend your points to perform different maneuvers based on your class.

Full Rules: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/WrestleWars.html

36982.name: Starts and Ends
36982.description:
Basically, the game consists of listing words related to a topic. Each word must either START or END in a key letter. Look at the graphic below to make this clear. You'll notice that every line has at least one shaded circle. A letter written in those shaded circles are the key letters for the word to be written in the next line. If a word passes through two shaded circles, then the player has a choice as to which letter he or she uses as the key letter for the next word.
(from website)

Full Game: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/StartsAndEnds.html

36983.name: Monopoly: Leeds (Limited Edition)
36983.description:
Only 500 copies of this private version of Monopoly were ever produced.

Note: This is different than the public version from 2008.

36984.name: Monopoly: Leeds Edition
36984.description:
The legendary board game is finally coming home to Leeds where local firm Waddingtons first began making the game for the UK market in 1936.

Spaces are expected to include Millennium Square, Temple Newsam, Harewood House, Leeds Metropolitan University, the Victoria Quarter, the Royal Armouries, Town Hall, Civic Hall, Kirkgate Market, and Headingley Carnegie Stadium. Thirty-three Leeds landmarks are to occupy the multi-coloured sites.

Note: This game is different than the limited edition which was produced in 1989 with 500 total copies.

36985.name: Logger
36985.description:
Four rival lumberjacks are competing to chop down the most trees for their business. However, standing in their way are tree-hugging hippies protesting the deforestation.

Logger is an Icehouse game that's played with up to 6 stashes and a 5x5 board. Players must plant, grow and chop down trees for points. They can also hinder their opponents' efforts by deploying protesters on their trees preventing them from being chopped down.

Complete set of rules are available.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

boardgamehonor: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Science-Fiction or Fantasy Board Wargame Nominee
36986.description:
All Things Zombie is a board game based on designed by Ed Teixeira of Two Hour Wargames and winner of the Origins 2005 Miniatures game of the year.

Gamers play as survivors trying to survive in a world populated with zombies, fighting intensely satisfying tactical battles as they roam the devastated land. As the minis game designer, Ed Teixeira says, "It's all about real life in an unreal world."

Featuring amazing art, and a detailed, yet accessible, design, All Things Zombie is a gamers' dream. All Things Zombie will appeal to both strategy gamers and RPGers alike. Whether searching a police station for guns and ammo, gunning down hordes of zombies, or blasting through a running gun battle with other not-so-nice-survivors, All Things Zombie will keep you on the edge of your seat.

All Things Zombie can be played solo, cooperatively, or competitively with everyone against each other. Whichever way you choose to play the game the zombies are run by the game mechanics and do not need to be run by one player.

The game includes six scenarios as well as a campaign game that insures a high degree of re-playability. Easy to learn but difficult to master All Things Zombie will provide the gamer with many hours of fun.

The new edition is now available titled All Things Zombies Reloaded.

New Edition In the Series:

All Things Zombie: Reloaded
36986.name: All Things Zombie: The Boardgame
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Fourteen of The Gaming Gang

36988.description:
Basic Tactics is a fast paced variation on the traditional card game of War, but with some strategic decisions. For 2 players.

You get: A one-page folded sheet with rules for the game on it, printed on parchment like paper.

You need: 1 standard deck of 52 cards (jokers optional) and a friend to play with.
36988.name: Basic Tactics

36989.name: Capture
36989.description: Capture is a card game for 2 players. You must capture more cards than the other player by the end of one play through the deck. Play proceeds via 5 columns in a round. If you have the best scoring hand in a column, you get all the cards in it.

36990.name: Stacks
36990.description: Stacks is a card game for 2 to 4 players, played using a special deck of cards prepared from three other decks. Each player tries to build up stacks of cards of their own, like in solitaire. Whoever has the highest total wins.

36991.name: Target Practice
36991.description: Target Practice is a fast game of throwing cards at the other player's line to score points. It provides an interesting change of pace in an evening of heavy duty strategy games. For 2 players.

36992.name: Slyderz
36992.description: This is a cross between Checkers and Sorry. It should be real easy for little kids to play. Basically you have to eliminate all your opponents pieces off the board. Each Player has 12 pieces that he/she can maneuver across a 4 piece map/board. The pieces have different movement patterns (like chess).

36993.name: COLORS
36993.description:
COLORS – the new two person strategy game by MAG (creators of CAVEMAN) - is very simple in its mechanics.

Colors is a 10 minute light-hearted game between two beginners, but becomes a 40 minute intellectual tussle when played by two COLORS “Grandmasters”

Each player has 12 pieces, 3 of each primary color (the game is environment friendly). These pieces are moved around a diamond shaped board made up of triangles, and there is no luck involved.

You take opponents pieces by creating triangles of the 3 primary colors – taking 1 piece if using two of your pieces to complete the triangle, or 2 opposing pieces if you make a triangle using only 1 of your pieces (the elusive “Double Take”).

Combine several mini-strategies to win the game – The Wall, The Blitz, The Raid, the Single take, the Double Take. There is lots to think about.

Despite this the game has just a single page of rules – nothing more to it than that – and has this in eleven difrferent languages (English, German, French, Italian, Spanish, Dutch, Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Finnish and Japanese)

COLORS - MINUTES TO LEARN, MONTHS TO MASTER by MAG

AVIALABLE DIRECT FROM MAG AT www.makeagame.eu

36994.name: Paper Football League
36994.description:
This is part card game and part board game for football (American). Some real simple plays both offensive and defensive. A sample league provided. There are different cards included, both offensive and defensive cards. You play your cards to try to get the football to score.

Full Game Here: http://www.cruzan.info/pgames/pgames.html

36995.name: Fan Craze
36995.description:
An antique baseball game. The wooden board displays a simple baseball diamond with holes at each base where pegs could be inserted to represent the base runners. The board also has holes for tracking the number of balls, strikes, runs and outs in an inning. The scores for each inning are recorded by writing them on the score card. A set of forty-eight playing cards are marked with the results of an at bat, such as "single", "hit by batted ball", "wild pitch", "double play", "stolen base", "out on steal", "out on foul", etc.

The components consist of a cardboard box, instructions, wooden board, score card, and (per the instructions) forty-eight cards. In addition, this particular example of the game is marked on the box cover as the "pocket edition" compliments of Longman & Martinez Paint Makers, New York City.

36996.name: Rainbo
36996.description:
A simple 2 player game where pieces move and capture based on a colored dot on their face.

Each player has 18 pieces of their color (White or Black) to place in secret in any arrangement of their choosing within their starting area. Each piece has a colored dot in 1 of 6 colors (Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple) and 1 of 3 sizes. Size and color of the dot determines rank, capturing ability and movement of each piece.

Play alternates between players and ends when one player has only one piece left on the board.

36997.name: The Victor
36997.description: A simple children's "spin and move" race game where the players seek to move their pieces from their start spaces to the end space, moving up the opposite sides of the board. The components include a game board and rules (both printed inside the bottom half of the box), a spinner, and a set of discs for each player.

36998.name: Life Savers Game
36998.description:
A game for two, four, or six players. The object of the game is for the players to use their life boats to rescue sailors from a wrecked ship and bring them to the beach. Avoid the hazardous "reef of rocks"!

The components consist of one "dial" (spinner), six differently colored counters (representing life boats), six differently colored discs (representing sailors.)

36999.name: Humpty Dumpty Sat On A Wall
36999.description:
A vintage, early twentieth century dexterity game. Each player has a small Humpty Dumpty figure which hangs from a suspended string. The players compete to maneuver their Humpty Dumpty onto a wall. Points are scored based on the facing and positioning of the Humpty Dumpty figure. For example, 20 points are scored for seating Humpty facing the player with both legs hanging over the side of the wall; but if only one leg is over the wall, the player scores 15 points. The winner is the first player to reach a predetermined number of points. An alternate race game is included where the players race to be the first to get their Humpty properly seated on the wall and detached from the string.

The components include the box, an instruction sheet, three Humpty Dumpty figures with string, three walls, and three clips used to attach the lines of string to the game table. The box and instructions state "British Manufacture. Made in England." No publisher is specified.

37000.description:
Partini
The party game with a delicious twist!
A great mix of games for the laugh-out-loud party crowd!

Open up the game box. Sprinkle friends around the room. Mix up the coasters, Then pick'em at random to play 6 games. Stir in a dash of drama, a splash of laughs and a double shot of silliness, and you've got a happy hour that will last all evening long!

Pick a coaster... play a game!

Hum Punch:
Hum it up in a musical challenge. No singing allowed! Hmm-Hmm-Hmm

What Not:
Don't say what it is, say what it's not! Will your team guess "Hot Dog" when you say, "It's not a cool cat"?

Straight Up:
Write something true or funny about a teammate. Will you get points for telling it like it is?

Bouncers:
Ready, aim, and fire balls into cups. The action changes with every draw of a card.

Mime Twist:
Zip your lips and act it out. Will your team guess "Stud Muffin" in the Lover Boy category?

Clay Smoothie:
Mold and fold clay into shapes that your teammates just might recognize... like a snowman.

Contents:35 Coasters, 430 Cards, 5 Plastic Cups, 2 Plastic Balls, Container of Partini Modeling Compound, 2 Pads of Paper, 4 Pencils, Timer, Die and Rules.
37000.name: Partini
boardgamepodcastepisode: TPGC - Episode #9 - Cranium and Partini

36501.name: Manifesto
36501.description:
"Players represent ideologies in conflict in the 20th century."

The players select one Ideology to play: Democracy, Communism, Fascism, Socialism, or Imperialism. If there are more than five players, five additional Ideologies are available: Totalitarianism, Parliamentarian, Dictatorship, Monarchy, and Fundamentalism.

The game is played on a map of the world divided into twenty regions. The components also include a custom deck of cards, consisting of Conflict Cards and Influence Cards.

"Object: Control the most countries by the end of the century. Ties are resolved by bidding. Each round represents 5 years. The game starts in 1900 and ends in 2000. There are 20 game rounds."

36502.name: Masters of the Universe
36502.description:
"Help He-Man defeat Evil Skeletor and his Minions."

"One player uses a Good Deck. The other player uses an Evil Deck. Each deck has 2 discard piles: A Reserve pile and a Casualty pile."

"Object: A player loses when all of his Leader cards are in his Casualty pile. The other player wins the game."

36503.name: Megazilla
36503.description:
"Megazilla attacks Tokyo!!!!!!! One player is Megazilla, the other is the Japanese military trying to defend the city."

The game is played on a map of Tokyo divided into "blocks." The blocks come in three types: Water, City, and Rural. The Megazilla player has one counter representing Megazilla. The JDF player has 80 counters representing land, air, and sea units of the Defense Force. Other counters include Rubble and Artillery Attack. The components also include a custom deck of cards used by the Megazilla player.

"Victory: The JDF (Japanese Defense Force) wins if Megazilla is ever at 75 or more points of damage. Megazilla wins if he makes it to the opposite end of the map and reduces at least half of the city blocks to rubble."

36504.name: Megiddo 1918
36504.description:
"WWI card game for 2 players. Recreate the last great cavalry campaign in history. One player is the British. The other player is the Turks."

Each player uses a custom card deck composed of the following types of cards: Cavalry, Infantry, Artillery, Planes, Machine Guns, Supply, Leader, and Nuisance Cards. Battles are resolved in a series of phases: Air Strike, Cavalry Exploitation, Artillery, Machine Gun, and Infantry. The player who wins each battle scores a Victory Point.

"Victory: The British win with 5 Victory points. This indicates that they have overrun the Turks, and that they have captured Damascus before their Arab allies led by Colonel Thomas Edward Lawrence, also known as Lawrence of Arabia. The Turks win with 3 Victory points. This indicates that the Turks have made a successful fighting withdrawal and that they have retreated back to Turkey without being overrun."

36505.name: Bac à la Carte
36505.description: A French party word game in which players try to identify words related to a theme on the cards. The title of the game is a pun on the "baccalauréat" examination.

36506.name: Match Attax
36506.description:
A collectible card game based on football players from the English Premier League.
In 2009, a German edition with players from the Bundesliga was released.

The aim of a game is to form a team of 14 (11 starting players and 3 substitutes), and to score more goals than your opponent by comparing attack or defense values on each player card.

Special cards include "Star Player" cards and "Man of the Match" cards.

36507.name: Blood and Bronze
36507.description:
Set firmly in Greek legend, Blood and Bronze mixes roleplaying and boardgaming aspects to make competitive and strategic 1-2 hour game. Each player acts as one of the cities of Greek legend using alliances, treachery, accusations and boasts all feature as the cities strive to be remembered as the greatest in all of Greece. To win the game strive to become dominate, called "Without Peer!" in 3 of four arenas: Army, Hero, King and God. If by the end of the agreed playing time no player has won, then the Game is said to have been won by those upstart Romans.

This game is described by the publisher as "much more a boardgame kind of thing than a role-playing game." Others have tried using the term "resource management game" to avoid both the board and RPG labels. It is available in both regular edition, with cardboard chits, and the Without Peer! edition that has bronze coins and a brass bowl.

The original version of the game was an entry in the 2005 Iron Game Chef RPG Game design competition This version is still a hybrid game but more towards the role-playing end of the spectrum than the final product.

36508.name: Comédia
36508.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Comédia, you'll imagine skits, mime words, play characters, and read scripts – alone, in pairs or in teams. Release your inner thespian, dress up however you like and play out of your skin! At any age, with friends or family, Comédia is a board game which will let your imagination run riot and which is also a perfect team-building educational tool for theater workshops, professional seminars, etc.

36509.description:
Alles auf Angriff is a soccer card game about "Die Wilden Fußballkerle". They are the main characters of a famous soccer book series for children.

The player tries to get 5 cards at first: 4 player cards and 1 trainer card.

The player can display one player card, get one card from an opponent or start an offense in order to get one player card from the opponent.

Luck and bluffing will pave the way to success.
36509.name: Alles auf Angriff

36510.name: The Game of Life Express
36510.description:
This dice game is a derivative of The Game of Life. It contains a dice bowl, a score pad and 10 dice.

The aim is to get as many Life Points at the end of the game as possible. You throw the dice up to three times each turn. If you collect the symbols you need for a life experience, you win Life Points.

The Game of Life Express is part of the Hasbro Express Line.

36512.name: Stampede!
36512.description:
Play six different card games while learning unique horse facts and vocabulary from each card.

Build a corral of cards before the mustangs escape in the solitaire game Stop the Stampede! Make rows of cards using higher and lower numbers in Rising Trot. Win cards to spell HORSE in Have You Herd? Collect sets of cards in Roundup and Colorful Horses, but avoid the lone mustang in Old Mare.

This versatile card deck also includes four bonus collectible horse breed cards.

36513.description:
Tien Gow, along with Pai Gow is one of the most popular games played with Chinese Dominoes.

Tien Gow is a trick-taking game, in which each of the dominoes has a specific value when played against other dominoes. The dominoes are divided into two suits: a "civilian" upper suit and a "military" lower suit.

Unlike many similar games like Bridge or Spades, each trick may involve the play of multiple dominoes at a time, and the goal of Tien Gow is to save a strong enough domino for the last hand of each round in order to win the last trick. Doing so, however, depends on having won at least 1/4 of the tiles in previous tricks, else the end trick is forfeited, so players can't simply save their best tiles until the end.

Tien Gow is traditionally played as a gambling game, but can be played for its own enjoyment as well.
36513.name: Tien Gow

36514.name: Alexander the Great's Campaigns
36514.description:
A book on the campaigns of Alexander with detailed information on pay scales, organization, logistics and march rates to help the miniature gamer recreate an accurate tabletop campaign.

" This book includes what is probably the most detailed and accurate account of Alexander as a military commander so far published as well as all the information on march rates, logistics, pay, loot, sieges, armament, organisation and other related factors required by wargamers.

It describes the troops of Alexander's own armies and their opponents, their tactics and weapons and how these altered to meet changing circumstances. As well as being a tremedously exciting and stimulating read, the book is thus an essential reference source, at once of immense value to Ancient wargamers and food for thought to serious historians." (from the dustjacket)

36515.name: Anera's Arena uitbreiding #2
36515.description:
This limited mini-expansion adds a single character to the game: the heavily armoured knight.

Expands:

Anera's Arena

36516.name: Sea battles in miniature. A guide to Naval Wargaming.
36516.description:
A comprehensive guide to Naval Wargaming with miniatures,covering ancient galley warfare, Napoleonic naval battles,the Ironclad period and the Dreadnought period. As well as providing and excellent potted summary of each period, there are simple and playable rules for each era.

"The chance to be an Admiral in command of some of the finest fleets in the history of naval warfare is not one which many me could resist. Here, at last, is a book which will not only enable you to reconstruct battles with great historical accuracy, but also to take charge of the fleets and shape the destiny of nations! The pages almost reek with the smell of powder and ring with the clmour of battle."

Contains chapters on:

-Naval wargaming in General, including building your own models and writing rules.
-Ancient galley warfare
-Napoleonic nval warfare.
-The Ironclad period.
-The Dreadnought period.
-Campaigns.

36517.name: A Wargamers' Guide to the Crusades
36517.description:
A concise and detailed account of the Crusades for the miniature wargamer. The book not only covers the background history, but provides background detail on the various military orders, the Assassins and the raising and financing of troops. Finally a detailed gazette of crusader castles rounds out the book.

160 pages with numerous maps and line drawings.

36518.name: The Original Preppie Game
36518.description: Preppy Life. Roll and move your way to getting schooled, getting drunk, getting privilege, and getting a trust fund from Mummy and Daddy.

36519.name: Love Tubes n° 1: Romeo + Juliet
36519.description:
Steaming sex or a passionate romance...

The Romeo and Juliet love tube is the fast track to romance and adventure, in the unlimited universe of sexual fantasy. It’s time to see how far you and your partner can take the pleasure principle. Romeo+Juliet is a game with intimate questions and lust arousing chores for two. The winner can expect extravagant indulgence, the loser can look forward to glorious punishment...

1 game board
1 book of questions and chores
1 book of romantic and adventurous punishments
2 counters
1 twenty sided love dice
1 rulebook
1 bag

36520.name: Castle Construction
36520.description: The game is played on a castle's foundation (a square grid) where players place their pieces of different colors, trying to get the largest groupings of their color together. As they play, players also lay walls and doors, as well as "room tiles", which determine the shape and size of each room in the castle.

36521.description:
An official expansion for the game Cuba, published in the European games magazine Spielbox, issue 1/08.

It introduces the Spielecafé tile to the game. The expansion comes with a translation into English.

As you can see from the tile, the activated building produces a rum and costs of 2 wood (white), 1 water (blue) and 2 stone (red) cubes.
36521.name: Cuba: Spielecafé

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2009 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players
36522.description:
2 de Mayo is an abstract game of the terrible incidents that took place in Madrid on May 2, 1808. On that date, civilians in Madrid — and a few Spanish army units — rebelled against the French occupation troops of Napoleon.

2 de Mayo is a bilingual (English and Spanish) boardgame for two players, in which each player controls the forces of one side, either Spanish or French. The game lasts 10 turns and takes about 20-30 minutes to play.
Each turn is divided into four phases:

Preparation
Orders
Movement
Resolution




At the end of Turn 10, the French player achieves victory if all the Spanish forces have been eliminated, all the access areas to Madrid are French garrisoned and has not lost four or more cubes. If a French victory does not apply, the Spanish player wins.

The game includes:

board showing the old map of Madrid, divided in 21 areas or zones
41 wooden cubes: 30 blue (representing the French troops), 10 red (representing the Spanish civilians and troops), and 1 unpainted used as the turn marker.
22 event cards, 11 French (blue back); and 11 Spanish (red back)
2 player aid cards
1 turn track card
rulebook, including historical commentaries and a full example of play
36522.name: 2 de Mayo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 30 - When All You Need is a Deck of Cards
RJ33: De birres i paella pel Vell Món
The Game Pit: Episode 17 - The Bumper End of Year Review

36523.description:
[EN] Strength, balance, bravery and good sense. These are the four key words for the castellers. In this game you will have to use all of them to emulate the brave castellers and to raise the higher towers of the game.


Components: 66 castellers wooden pieces in 4 colours, 2 sets of stickers, 12 pinya base tiles, 2 bonus tokens, 1 bag, a set of rules.
Game has rules in English, Spanish, Catalan and Portuguese.



[ES] Fuerza, equilibrio, valor y sensatez. Estas son las cuatro palabras clave de los castellers. En este juego tendrás que usarlas todas para emular a los valientes castellers y levantar los castells más altos de la partida.


Componentes: 66 castellers de madera de 4 colores, 2 conjuntos de adhesivos, 12 baldosas base de la pinya, 2 fichas de bonus, 1 bolsa, reglas.
El juego dispone de reglas en inglés, castellano, catalán y portugués.



[PT] Força, equilibrio, valor e sensatez. Estas são as quatro palavras chave dos castellers. Neste jogo terás que usá-las todas para simular os valentes castellers e levantar os castells mais altos da partida.


Componentes: 66 castellers de madeira em 4 cores, 2 conjuntos de autocolantes, 12 bases de pinya, 2 fichas de bónus, 1 bolsa, regras.
O jogo vem com regras em inglês, castelhano, catalão e português.



[CA] Força, equilibri, valor i seny. Aquestes són les quatre paraules clau dels castellers. En aquest joc hauràs d'emprar-les totes per tal d'emular als valents castellers i aixecar els castells més alts de la partida.


Components: 66 castellers de fusta de 4 colors, 2 conjunts d'adhesius, 12 rajoles base de la pinya, 2 fitxes de bonus, 1 bossa, regles.
El joc disposa de regles en anglès, castellà, català i portuguès.
36523.name: Castellers
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #72 - Viva Los Juegos

36524.name: Shanghaien: Extrakarte 1
36524.description:
This is a small expansion for the base-game Shanghaien. It is based in an extra card called "Shanghai forbidden / Re-roll all dice".

You can download the cards here:

http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXPUS1.pdf (english, letter)
http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXP1.pdf (german, DINA4)
http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXPE1.pdf (spanish)

36525.description: Game about Austrian offensive from August 1914. Over 400,000 soldiers from both sides (Austro-Hungarian and Russian) fought in fierce battle near Kraśnik (now in Poland) on 23-35 September. In the battle, a decisive role was played by manoeuvre and the power of artillery.
36525.name: Kraśnik 1914

36526.name: Lotto
36526.description: A telephone dial points to the brightly coloured picture which the child may "discard" if he happens to have the same picture in front of him. The child uses the dial to turn the colours indicated by the 2 dice he has thrown. If the arrow on the dial points to a picture that corresponds to a picture which the child has in front of him on the table, the child may turn it over. The first player to succeed in turning over the pre-determined number of cards is the winner. The game consists of a telephone dial, 72 cards and 2 colored dice.

36527.name: White Squadron
36527.description:
The White Squadron is a set-building card game similar to the children's game "Fish" or "Go Fish."

The 52 cards in the deck depict warships of the U.S. Navy around the turn of the century. It was evidently printed in many editions because at least one copy seems to date from about 1919 based on the ships depicted, even though the original copyright date is 1896.

The ships are divided into "fleets" of four similar ships, mostly historical class sister ships ranking from "A" through "M" with each ship in the fleet numbered from "1" though "4."

For example, the "A" fleet comprises the battleships Oklahoma, Nevada, New York and Texas. The "M" fleet comprises the submarines Plunger, Porpoise, Shark and Moccasin.

Each card lists its identifying number "A-1, M-4"; the name of the ship in larger type with the sister ships in smaller type; a photograph or drawing of the ship and a three-line description.

For example, the Plunger's description reads: "PLUNGER -- Submarine torpedo boat. Holland type, operated by gasoline when in the surface and electricuty when submerged. 63 feet long. Has 3 14-inch Whitehead torpedoes for sub-sea attack."

The object of the game is to collect "fleets" of four cards with the winner being the player with the most "fleets" at the end of play.

Five cards are dealt to each player with the surplus forming a common draw pile.

The player to the dealer's left begins by asking any one player for a specific card . For example, "Do you have H-3 Massachusetts?" If the player has the card he must give it to the caller, who can then ask for another card from anyone around the table.

If the targeted player doesn't have the card, then the caller must draw one card from the draw pile and play passes to the left.

Once four cards in the same fleet are collected the player paces them down on the table face up.

If a player has no cards then he is entitled to draw two cards from the draw pile.

Once the draw pile is exhausted, play continues with the cards in hand only until all the fleets are formed.

The rules don't say, but presumably players who have no cards and can't draw from the draw pile can still continue to play and acquire cards for a fleet, although they would be vulnerable to poaching from other players.

36528.name: Lex'-i-con
36528.description:
This game almost mirrors that of Balderdash, but was published about 9 years prior. The game play is the same in that one player reads a word and the others try to fake out everyone by writing down a fictional definition. Points are awarded when others pick yours as the correct definition.

This may be one of the first packagings of the old Dictionary Game.

36530.name: Estate Playing Cards
36530.description: This is an Australian 62-card deck with 5 suits of 12 cards. The suits are Waves (green), Hearts (red), Diamonds (yellow), Clubs (blue), and Spades (black). Each suit contains 12 cards - Ace, Woman, Man, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, and 2. The jokers have been replaced by a Pope and a President card. The deck comes with a leaflet that has rules for the games of Waves (aka Black Pete), Estate Bridge, 600, Pusoy Dos, Poker, Canasta, and Euchre. It can easily be used to play other card games like Solitaire, Snap, Crazy 8s and Rummy.

36531.name: Rapid' Sushi
36531.description:
Radpi'Sushi is a real time card game for 2 players.
Each player is a famous restaurant server of
RAPID'SUSHI.

This restaurant has become famous thanks to the speed of service:
fifteen customers is indeed served in less than 2 minutes.

With this reputation, customers are already queuing in front of the restaurant with their Sushi command.

It's up to you to serve sushi tables faster than your opponent and win the round of the day..

After one week of work, the boss will display the winner of the week in the famous restaurant.

This was first do it yourself game and now the game is available on the edition world.

36532.name: International Elite S.W.A.T.
36532.description:
International Elite S.W.A.T. the Boardgame (tentative name)

S.W.A.T. the boardgame is a strategic, tactical police simulation game based on modern weapons and technology for 1 to 6 players. Play with pre-made characters or create your own character from scratch and watch your character rise through the ranks. Players may use weapons in accordance with their style of play ranging from assault rifles to sniper rifles that are fully customizable with various scopes, suppressors, and sights.

Play 3 different maps:
- The Bank: Small Map
- The Plane: Medium Map
- The Mansion Estate: Large Map

Play with 6 different weapons:
- Assault Rifles
- Submachine Guns
- Light Machine Guns
- Shotguns
- Sniper Rifles
- Sidearm Pistols

Complete your arsenal with numerous supplementary weapons:
- Grenades
- Smoke Grenades
- Thermal Goggles
- Gas Masks
- Various Suppressors
- Various Gun Scopes
- Various Tactical Sights
- Armor Piercing Bullets
- Tear Gas
- Breaching Charges

Players read through a Mission Booklet and decide which of the missions to perform. Terrorists are set up and players set up on their starting locations. Each mission will have an objective and a secondary objective for those playing with Career Mode Characters.

Types of Missions:
- Hostage rescue
- Escort the V.I.P.
- Retrieve and escape
- Double assassination
- Protect control points
- and many more

36533.description:
Chaos on Cronos is Pulp Sci-Fi miniatures rules from Scott Pyle of Four-Color Figures. These rules use Scott's Goalsystem.

From the author:
"Rocket into the far future with Chaos on Cronos, the Goalsystem tabletop miniature game of Pulp Science Fiction! Chaos on Cronos is a skirmish game designed for heroic scale 28mm miniatures, and uses designs and characters from Blue Moon Manufacturing's excellent line of Spacemen and Aliens. Cronos works great with as few as 5 figures per side, and using the Goalsystemʼs innovative Robot Legion rules, can accommodate as many as 20-30 figures per side! All you need to play are these rules, a handful of six-sided dice, and some Blue Moon miniatures! Cronos also features complete model creation rules so you can stat up your favorite Pulp sci-fi heroes, villains, and soldiers for battle!"

Available in PDF.
36533.name: Chaos on Cronos

36534.description:
The Trioker pieces are similar to the 24 mac-mahon triangles, except that the values are set at the corners instead of the sides. There is also a 25th special triangle, called Joker

There are two boards allowing two different kind of games : a pure abstract game for 2 players, and a bidding game for 2 to 3 players. Also included a set of puzzles to be solved for a single player.

At first sight, Trioker looks very much like Tri-Ominos, but in fact it is a much more complex game, with lots of logic involved.
36534.name: Trioker

36535.name: Mine Eyes Have Seen the Glory
36535.description:
From the DG website:

Mine Eyes Have Seen the Glory (NEW), aka Glory, has been moved back to new status due to an exciting development. The designer has added two new elements to the game that will make this a truly unique ACW game. First, he is adding Manifest Destiny, a Mexican-American War mini-game that will serve as an introductory scenario. This short campaign will give new players an excellent place to start playing and veteran players will have a game that can be finished in an evening. The second element is Crisis & Compromise, a card play oriented game of the period from the end of the Mexican-American War to the start of the Civil War. Though little combat occurs (guerrilla warfare in Kansas, etc.), the card play covers the actions inspiring events, leaders and regional positions (Border States) that affect the allegiance of states to a region and the ability of military leaders at the start of the Civil War. Crisis & Compromise can be played alone or used to create alternative starting situations for Glory.

Glory is a grand strategy game of the American Civil War in the style of Krieg! Maps of the Eastern and Western Theaters include terrain, Strategic Objectives, roads/rail, naval zones, navigable and non-navigable rivers, cities and locales, supply centers and other features affecting the game. Counters represent the corps and armies of the war. Cards provide the strategic-political-economic direction for each side. Strategies are many and varied but the ultimate goal is to demoralize the opposing faction's population through military, economic and political victories while sustaining your own population's will to continue the fight. The players each choose a Strategy Card and an Addendum Card before each new season and may opt to play an additional card as a diplomatic response to certain events. These cards lead to new military units, leaders, and replacement steps and result in socio-economic and political events. The events include the declaration of Emancipation, the elections of 1862 and 1864, and the possible intervention by European nations. Events are often double-edged swords, sometimes providing a military advantage while negatively affecting the popular will to fight. In addition, both sides may attempt to develop and manufacture new technologies, both historical and speculative, such as ironclads, submarines, torpedoes, observation balloons, repeating rifles and Gatling guns. Both sides can introduce espionage and even sabotage, which can have many unexpected consequences, including assassination. Three maps, 352 large counters for Glory and 280 small counters for Manifest Destiny and Crisis & Compromise, 220 cards.

36536.name: Clubhouse: the tee to green golf game
36536.description: Players play their way through the Druid's Forest golf course using 3 coloured dice to determine the results of each golf shot. Distance is determined by a book of "Club Cards" showing the results of each die combination for each club chosen. The game is played on 2 large boards showing the 2 halves of the course. Scorecards and player markers are included.

36537.name: Pennywise
36537.description:
"The Strategy Game of Common Cents"

This two-player game was inspired by Nim - the popular game, played with piles of objects, that was invented by mathematician Charles Bouton in 1902. It appeared in the October, 1995 issue of Games Magazine, and requires 49 pennies (or other small objects).

The game is played on a 7x7 board filled with one penny per square, although each player removes one penny of their choice at the beginning of the game. Game play consists of players alternating turns of removing two or three adjacent pennies from the same horizontal or vertical row. The last player to be able to remove such a group wins.

36538.description:
As stated in the box: " El país legendario del vampiro se halla en el Este de Europa, especialmente en Rumania. Allí se encuentra, en la provincia de Transilvania, el lugar que el autor británico Bram Stoker eligió para su famosa historia de Drácula.

La historia se remonta a la Edad Media, donde un cauidillo llamado Vlad Tapes, que significa 'Vlad el empalador', tenía el sangriento hábito de empalar a sus enemigos en estacas y beber su sangre, de ahí su similitud con Drácula.

Cuenta la leyenda que toda persona mordidad por un vampiro se convierte en vampiro. Sólo hay una forma de acabar con él: clavándole una estaca en el corazón'

Drácula (El vampiro del castillo) es un juego de terror para jugadores de 9 a 90 años, en el que pueden participar de 2 a 4 jugadores.


Translation: "The legendary country of the vampire exists on Eastern Europe, exactly in Romania. There is the province of Transylvania, place that inspired the British author Bram Stoker to create his famous Dracula.

The story starts on the middle ages, where a local Lord called Vlad Tapes, meaning 'Vlad the Impaler', had the bloody habit of impaling his enemies and drinking their blood, from there the similarities with Dracula.

The legend tells that anybody bitten by a vampire will become a vampire. There is only one way to finish it, that is by nailing a stake through its heart".

Dracula is a game of terror for players Ages 9 and up, and for 2 to 4 players.


The game comes with:

- A board game
- 24 vampires
- 24 plastic bases
36538.name: Dracula: El Vampiro del Castillo

36539.name: Slick-Tac-Toe
36539.description:
This game appeared in the June, 1996 issue of Games Magazine. It requires tokens, which are not included.

Players slide their tokens along the board, attempting to score points by getting them all along a line. First player to three points wins.

36541.name: Osbox
36541.description:
Players push a six-sided die from adjacent sides of a 4x4 grid in an attempt to complete loops that extend both horizontally and vertically. In the basic game, one player has access only to the left and right sides, while the other has access exclusively to the top and bottom sides.

The author designed with the game with the same Celtic knot picture cubes used in Osbo, but this game doesn't make use of rotating the sides. The same face of the die stays visible once the die is entered.

36542.name: Trugo
36542.description:
Trugo is a board-less tile-laying game with Go-like capture. It has a "Waxing" phase, in which tiles and chips are added, and a "Waning" phase, in which chips are moved or tiles are removed to capture the chips they touch.

Trugo can be played with 36 Mambo tiles (plus 2 colors of chips, 25 each) by treating red and blue segments as equivalent.

36544.name: Oakland Raiders Jenga
36544.description:
Take the Raiders™ to the top!

Play Jenga® a fun new way – with Oakland Raiders blocks and Raiders dice that add excitement to the game! It’s the same great game with a Raiders twist. Build your tower with Raiders black and gray blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom Raiders Jenga rules make the game even more challenging and fun! Roll the dice and make the play… “Touchdown” reverses the direction of play; “Interception” allows you to remove one black and one gray block and the “Raiders Shield” means you pick another player to remove and stack any block. The last player to remove a block without tumbling the tower wins the game.

36545.name: JENGA: Pittsburgh Steelers Collector's Edition
36545.description:
Take the Steelers™ to the top!

Play Jenga® a fun new way – with Pittsburgh Steelers blocks and Steelers dice that add excitement to the game! It’s the same great game with a Steelers twist. Build your tower with Steelers black and yellow blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom Steelers Jenga rules make the game even more challenging and fun! Roll the dice and make the play… “Run” means you remove a yellow block; “INT” allows you to remove one black and one yellow block while the “Steelers Logo” means you get to skip your turn. The last player to remove a block without tumbling the tower wins the game.

36547.description:
The MOON MULLINS Game based on the comic strip of the same name. The comedic things that happen in the cartoon strip happen in this game from "Bumping in to a Fat Lady" which causes you to move back 2 spaces to "Tripping over Carpets" which results in your being able to advance 3 spaces. This is a simple roll and move game from the late 1930's.

Components for 1927 ed:
16.25 x 16.5" non-character specific game board
5 die-cut thin cardboard full-color character playing pieces
4-1/8 x 4-1/8" separate spinner with large image of "Kayo!"
set of character playing cards
36547.name: The Moon Mullins Game

36548.name: Happy Camper
36548.description:
This game appeared in the August, 1996 issue of Games Magazine. It can be played on any flat surface, and requires cards, dominoes, coins, or any other objects that can be arranged in rows and columns.

Each player starts with "campers" in a grid-like "campsite." Players take turns moving campers from their opponent's campsite into their own, according to rules inspired by the "Game of Life" mathematical simulation by John Horton Conway. When no more moves are possible, each player scores points based on the campers in his or her campsite. In the simplest version, most campers wins.

36549.name: The Great Space Race
36549.description:
"Race to the moon and back as the United States of America and the Soviet Union compete for International prestige. The game starts in the late 1950's and spans 3 decades. It attempts to simulate the economy, the military, and the scientific community as they play crucial roles in the race to the moon. This is only a game but the events contained herein are real. You'll experience the frustrations of failure and the joys of success as we take you back in time into the Great Space Race."

The game board depicts a track 30 spaces long. The object is to be the first player to get to the moon (space 30) and return back to Earth (space 1). The game also uses a deck of Launch Cards broken down into three groups reflecting events of the fifties, sixties, and seventies.

36550.description:
Bashni is a traditional Russian game in the Checkers family.

The game is identical to Shashki (Russian Checkers) in the rules regarding movement, capture, and promotion, but every time a piece is captured, it is put at the bottom of the capturing piece or stack. If the captured piece is itself on a stack, only the top piece is captured, and the underlying pieces are thus "liberated". This means pieces are never permanently removed, but stacks get steadily higher throughout the game.

According to Abstract Games magazine issue 1, the game has a revival in Russia, with tournaments being held in St. Petersburg regularly.

Bashni was the inspiration for Laska, Chess world champion Emanuel Lasker's stacking game, that is better known in the west.
36550.name: Bashni

36551.name: No Limit Texas Dreidel
36551.description:
Texas Hold'em Poker with Dreidels!

Players get a couple of dreidels in the hole (not seen by other players) and together with a three more communal dreidels bet chocolate gelt against the other players that they have the best 5-dreidel combination.

The standard edition is for 2 to 4 players, but the deluxe edition has enough dreidels for 8 players.

Home Page: http://www.texasdreidel.com/index.php

36552.name: Man Hunt
36552.description:
Title: Man Hunt, by Parker Brothers, circa 1937.

The following information is summarized from the game rules.

"""The Idea of The Game"""

Each player is an agent in pursuit of a criminal. By means of clues furnished on the cards and in the envelopes you may, by the use of a little judgment, be the first to catch your criminal and earn the major portion of the reward. For two to six players.

"""Equipment"""

1 Game board - An outline map of the United States, showing the names of states, cities, and routes of travel that must be used when traveling from one city or state to another.

6 Different colored Pins- Used to represent each player.

24 Biographical cards- Each showing a sketch and biographical information on a separate criminal.

A few examples of biographical cards include a few BLACK AMERICANA cards:

"LUCKY" HAMES, WANTED for holdup and robbery in Jackson, Miss., on April 5, 1936. Age 31, Height 5 ft. 7 inches. Weight 136 lbs. Eyes maroon, complexion black. Hair usually close cut. If arrested notify police at Jackson, Miss.

"WHITEY" COLLINS, WANTED for murder of white man in Dallas, Texas, on February 8, 1934. Age 33, Colored, Height 5 feet 7 inches. Weight 155 lbs. Hair black and kinky, eyes maroon, complexion full black. If arrested notify Police Department of Dallas, Texas.

"TOMBSTONE" THOMPSON, WANTED for hold-up and robbery of a woman in Abilene, Texas, on Sept. 30, 1936. Age 31, Height 5 feet 9 inches; Weight 165 lbs. Very prominent front teeth---one gold. Typical field hand, close cropped hair. Scar under right eye. If arrested communicate with Police, Abilene, Texas.

"MIDNIGHT" JOHNSON, WANTED in Atlanta, Georgia, for slashing another negro with razor, in fight over crap game, Dec. 31, 1936. Age 31, Height 5 feet 7 inches, Weight 145 lbs., Sporty dresser, black, short, fairly straight hair. Scar on nose. Hold and notify Atlanta Police.

24 Envelopes bearing each criminals name - Each envelope contains either four or five clues to assist in tracking the criminal and trace his movements.

2 dice - Used to determine player movement.

160 Bills - Paper money in denominations of $100, $50, $20, and $10.

"""To Start"""

Each player is given $1000.00 and puts $500.00 into a pool which is set aside to serve as reward money. Players then randomly choose a criminal to track. Opposing players then are provided the clue envelopes for their opponent's criminal. Players then place their pin on the map where their criminal is wanted. Highest roll of the dice goes first.

"""The Play"""

Players then attempt to track their criminal first by reading the biographical card, and judging what location the next clue to his whereabouts may be obtained. Dice are then rolled to determine the distance the player can move, the full amount of two dice for air travel, the large number of the two for express train, or the smaller number of the two dice for automobile. Upon arrival at his destination he will ask the player holding his clue envelope if a clue is found at the location. If no clue is found he must return to the city he started from, or last city where he obtained a clue. Players may also send other players on missions to uncover clues for them. If the player being sent refuses the mission he must pay $100 into the reward pool. If he goes on the mission and uncovers a clue for another player he will receive $50 from that player. If no clue is uncovered, the player sending him on the mission pays $50 to the reward pool.

The final clue will advise of the death or capture of the criminal.The first player to uncover all of the clues for his criminal receives $1000, the second to finish $800, and third $600, and any players after $500, or until the reward pool money is exhausted. The player with the most reward money at the end is the winner.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
36553.description: Based on the popular game Time's Up!, Time's Up: Title Recall challenges players to guess the titles of books, films, songs, and more. Players try to get other players to guess the same set of titles over three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many titles as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round 2 no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted.) In round 3, no words are allowed at all.
36553.name: Time's Up! Title Recall!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 14: Holey Pants, Batman!
MN 0075 Party On, Gamers
Session Impressions: Time's Up!
The Game Pit: Episode 40 - Council Chamber Mega Review of 2014 with Top 5s
The Game Pit: Episode 44 - Lobstercon
The Good, The Board and The Creep:  Episode 44 “Daniel’s Top Ten”
TPGC - Episode #5 - Taboo, Time's Up and Time's Up: Title Recall
TPGC- Episode #30- Time's Up Title Recall, Slash: Romance without Boundaries and Monikers

36554.description:
Translated from publisher's description:
The small Eskimo child Enuk is already completely excited. Today he may go with his large brothers on journey into the ice. Finally he may see the wild polar bears on their way, watch the seals fishing and fish himself through the ice holes. At most, however, he looks forward to building the igloo with the others. However, the day goes on much too fast...

The children have to build the igloo and to observe as many animals as possible at the same time. Who collects most animal tiles and builds the igloo successfully, will win!

Description of the mechanics:
Enuk is a mixture of memory and push-your-luck. Players turn over animal tiles, until they want to quit or one of the animals is scared and flees: the herring flee from the salmon, salmon flees from the seal, the seal flees from the polar bear and the polar bear flees from the Eskimo. How many tiles dare you turn over?
36554.name: Enuk

36555.description:
Originally an ancient Hindu game for children, Pulijudam is a two player strategy game free from elements of chance. It is almost an abstract strategy game, but one of its alternative names, "Lambs and Tigers", suggests the theme overlaid for children.

Pulijudam is very similar to Bagh Chal and Fox and Geese - it is essentially a member of the Hnefatafl family of asymmetrical abstract games, although of very different origin. One player uses three pieces representing tigers; the other player uses fifteen pieces representing lambs. The initial placement of the three tigers is fixed. The lamb player begins to place his fifteen lambs wherever they wish in the twenty remaining spaces on the board; neither side can move any pieces until all of that type have been placed. Therefore the tigers may begin to move from the third turn while the lambs may only move from the fifteenth turn.

Each piece may move to any vacant adjacent space on the board (effectively orthogonally). Tigers may 'eat' lambs by jumping over an adjacent lamb into a vacant space beyond.

The game is won when the tigers have captured all the lambs or the lambs have encircled the tigers preventing them from moving.
36555.name: Pulijudam

36556.description:
Subject : This game covers the fourth battle for Tsaritsyn, from June, 12th to July, 1st 1919. Wrangel's cavalry Army of the Caucasus attacks the fortified area of the Red Verdun. With infantry and tanks reinforcements, coupled with sudden appearance of Mamontov's cavalry corps manoeuvring on the rears, the Whites manage to take the city at the end of June.
The Reds benefit from special advantages such as Budyenny's cavalry corps, river flotillas and trenches.

Scale : regiments or brigades. 1 hex = 4 km. 1 turn = 1 day

English or French versions available. 20 pages booklet (rules and historical article), a player aid and 306 full-colour counters. The map is 42*60 cm (about 16*24 inches).
The counters have to be cut and mounted (high quality Desk Top Game).

booklet contents :
- Rules : 9 pages
- Examples : 1p
- three scenarios : 3p
- historical notes : 3p (and maps)
- author's notes and play notes : 1p

Scenarios :
- introductory scenario
- scenario in 4 turns : the last days of the battle
- the full battle
36556.name: Tsaritsyn 1919

36557.name: E-GADS
36557.description:
E-GADS was developed by Bob Slater to raise funds for humanitarian projects around the world.

Contestants move around the game board collecting cards and attempting to slow down the progress of the other players. When a player lands on a "War" space a special die roll settles the conflict using the classic rock/paper/scissors method!

Includes a colorful game board, tokens, dice, score sheets, cards, instructions, and storage insert.

(c)2002 Core Club International

36558.name: Rose Bowl Computerized Football
36558.description: The offense calls out one of 14 plays. Players then consult a shared Play Chart with 15 result columns to determine their desired result and then select one of 8 values in their "analog computer" -- a box with two selector wheels and a result window. The result (the sum of the 2 numbers) is display by opening a window to a 3rd door in the computer. Players view play result on the Play Chart and move the ball on the field contained in the game box. A quarter is equivalent to 15 plays.

36559.name: Sons Of Hercules
36559.description:
Based on a syndicated television show from the 1960s. The show itself was a repacking of a number of Italian sword-and-sandal epics, most of which had nothing to do with Hercules.

There are six events shown on the game board, but they have noting to do with the mechanics. Players roll two dice and by using the number on each die, or the sum, try to cover one of the six spaces on the board. The player that covers the last spot receives an award ring. Players can also challenge an opponent for their rings. First player with four award rings wins.

Milton Bradley number is 4632.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Årets Spill Best Children's Game Nominee
2008 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended
36560.description:
From the rules:
Freddy the Piglet has a difficult task, because lots of tasty tidbits are hidden in the forest and he has to keep an eye on them all.
The squirrels in the Hazelnut Gang are up to their usual mischief, however, and have also taken an interest in the crunchy hazelnuts, juicy berries, chestnuts and fir cones.
Your task is to be the first to steal 7 tidbits from under Freddy’s nose! Whoever manages this will be the new leader of the HAZELNUT GANG!

Players move their squirrels on the board and then rotate the board on top of the box. When rotating the board, metal food tiles may click to the magnetic squirrels. The game is very simple and suitable for children aged four or more.
36560.name: Click Clack

36561.name: Trigos imin
36561.description:
The game is made of 36 wooden cubes in four colors. There is no board: the cubes move on the playing surface, and the space changes as the game goes on.

The rules propose two different games :

IMIN is a movement game in which you must eliminate the cubes of your opponents on an horizontal ever changing 2D surface.

ASH is a 3D game: in the first phase you must try to form a square of four cube horizontally or vertically; if no one wins, then in the second phase you must eliminate the highest number of your opponents' cubes.

36563.name: Video Grin 'N' Bear It
36563.description:
Video Grin 'N' Bear It is a game designed by Bizarre Games and Spitting Image.
The game includes a 60 minute VHS video, hosted by Hysterical Eddie, a puppet created by Spitting Image.
Before playing the game 6 props from around the home are selected. Each prop is labeled 1 to 6, to correspond with the spots on the huge game die.
Each player then also receives 6 laughter tokens.
The tape issued various challenges and players lose their tokens for doing something wrong.
The last player remaining with tokens is the winner.
There are also variations for play included with the games rules.

36564.name: Spe-Lingo
36564.description: Spe-Lingo is a game of words. Each player competes for high score by composing words from letters dealt him. The system of play is similar to the card game Rummy.

36565.name: A Man Called Mr. President
36565.description: Players attempt to guess the United States President that appears on the bottom of a card, based on clues on the top of the card.

36566.name: Bitva
36566.description:
Bitva (in English "Battle") is a light abstract wargame, played on a hex grid. This game is playable either as a 2-player or a 4-player game in two variations - an easier game with less options or more difficult (in a manner) with more options and restrictions on movement/opponent elimination.

You basically roll two 6-sided dice and them can jump with one of your soldiers from the field numbered on either the first/second die to a field numbered on the second/first die.

Example: you roll 2 and 6 and therefore you can jump from 2 to 6 or from 6 to 2 (you are not allowed to jump 2 to another 2 or 6 to another 6) if your soldier stands in a formation (2 soldiers on adjacent hexes). If you land on a square with your opponent, you eliminate him from the board. If your soldier stands as a single unit, he can only jump onto an adjacent hex (providing appropriate numbers have been rolled).

There is also one general per side which can jump on any appropriately numbered hex even if he does not stand in a formation. He also has 2 (or just 1 in case of 4 players) "Home hexes" where no soldier can attack him unless all other soldiers of the general's side are dead already.

When the enemy general is removed from game, the game ends.

In the advanced game there is an inner area which is used for elimination. The outer area is a no-fighting zone (cover).

36567.description:
The objective of the game is to create as many complete flower as possible before the caterpillar is completed.

Each turn, the player rolls the dice. Either she adds a part to the caterpillar or she takes a petal of the color indicated on the dice. A flower is completed when all of the petals are of the same color or when they are all of different colors. Instead of taking a new petal, a player may also choose to move one from one flower to another.

There is a minimum strategy to use in this game, so it's great for kids who love flowers. The wooden pieces are all magnetic and are of high quality. You can also bypass the game and just "play" with the components.
36567.name: Flower Garden

36568.name: Norse Odyssey
36568.description:
"A solo dice game of Viking Raids of the Ninth Century. Summer of 869...You and your 10 Kinsmen from Olafursdal, Norway build the most beautiful dragon ship ever constructed on the Heimdalsfjord and set sail to trade and loot the riches of Europe. It's early April and you have 32 weeks (turns) before you have to be back home when the winter comes."

"Victory: Keep book of the turns. If you don't get to Norway before turn 32 is over, you perish in the cold Northern European Winter. If you get to Norway, you can continue the next spring. With multiple players, the richest player is the winner on turn 32."

36569.description:
from the publisher:

LEGENDS OF THE TRACK - 1,500 METRES

'Legends' is our third simulation of the classic track event. First came 'The Metric Mile', much played both solo and as a multi-play and postal game but in my opinion rather bland. A recent re-working of the game has improved it I believe but whilst it requires user input in terms of deciding what Mode to use for each athlete each Turn it lacks the detail of 'Three-and-three Quarter Laps', which remains my preferred choice for that type of simulation. 'Legends' is what I term an 'eye-in-the-sky' game, the user is 'looking down' on the track with no more involvement than rolling the dice, consulting the Charts and keeping the Race Control Sheet up-dated. A few years ago 'Legends' could not have been published, the demand was all for 'involvement' games, where the user's input had a definite effect on the outcome. 'The Sport of Kings', with its many small decisions all affecting the final outcome, is typical of that genre.

But recently we have noticed a trend towards the complete solo game, with no opportunity to influence the outcome, maybe for fear of spoiling the purity of sporting history by allowing personal bias to creep in, maybe just because gamers are going through a phase where they prefer to sit back and watch it all happen in front of them, in control but not controlling the replay.

Whatever, the brief for 'Legends' was for a non-involvement ATG simulation with races playable in 10-12 minutes, accurate (of course) as far as any mixed-era simulation can be, providing enough detail and stats. (split and final times) to keep the hard-core replay gamer happy and with a system that needed a minimum of book-keeping. Hopefully that is what you have got with 'Legends', playing time around 10 minutes, a simple but effective Track Display, one hundred ATG athletes who will run their races in the way they usually ran them in real life (but with ability to change race 'plans' if you wish) with times geared to 2007 standards, pace-makers, 'fast' and normal tracks, weather effects, race 'quality' effects and fitness levels.

We think 'Legends' will be an ideal vehicle for solo campaigns, enough 'going on' to keep the interest at a high level, fun to run races, and the chance to run a full season incorporating Grand Prix meetings, Olympics (or World Championships), world-record attempts and with a few minor meetings flung in to keep the mix flexible.
36569.name: Legends of The Track

36572.name: Kiss & Cry: Women's Figure Skating Game
36572.description:
Features All skaters who appeared in at least 2 competitions during the 2005-2006 season are included

Each skater rated in 7 different categories, from technical elements to deductions.

Separate .pdf files for each country allow for easy competition setup. Run any event from a single country exhibition to an Olympic final. Both short and long programs available.

Optional scoring modifiers and homer judges rules
